verses.t: Now{G3767} when Festus{G5347} was come{G1910} into the province{G3588}, after{G3326} three{G5140} days{G2250} he ascended{G305} from{G575} Cæsarea{G2542} to{G1519} Jerusalem{G2414}.
Then{G1161} the high priest{G3588} and{G2532} the chief{G4413} of the Jews{G2453} informed{G1718} him{G846} against{G2596} Paul{G3588}, and{G2532} besought{G3870} him{G846},

And desired{G154} favour{G5485} against{G2596} him{G846}, that{G3704} he would send for{G3343} him{G846} to{G1519} Jerusalem{G2419}, laying{G4160} wait{G1747} in{G2596} the way{G3588} to kill{G337} him{G846}.
But{G3767} Festus{G5347} answered{G611}, that Paul{G3588} should{G3195} be kept{G5083} at{G1722} Cæsarea{G2542}, and{G1161} that he himself{G1438} would depart{G1607} shortly{G5034} thither.

Let them{G3588} therefore{G3767}, said he{G5346}, which{G3588} among{G1722} you{G5213} are able{G1415}, go down with{G4782} me, and accuse{G846} this{G2723} man{G5129}, if{G1487} there be{G2076} any{G5100} wickedness{G1722} in{G3588} him{G846}.Scrambled Tags

And{G1161} when he had tarried{G1304} among{G1722} them{G846} more{G4119} than{G2228} ten{G1176} days{G2250}, he went down{G2597} unto{G1519} Cæsarea{G2542}; and the next day{G1887} sitting{G2523} on{G1909} the judgment seat{G3588} commanded{G2753} Paul{G3588} to be brought{G71}.

And{G1161} when{G3854} he{G846} was come{G3854}, the Jews{G2453} which{G3588} came down{G2597} from{G575} Jerusalem{G2414} stood round about{G4026}, and laid{G5342} many{G4183} and{G2532} grievous{G926} complaints{G157} against{G2596} Paul{G3588}, which{G3739} they could{G2480} not{G3756} prove{G584}.

While{G3754} he answered{G626} for himself{G846}, Neither{G3777} against{G1519} the law{G3588} of the Jews{G2453}, neither{G3777} against{G1519} the temple{G3588}, nor yet{G3777} against{G1519} Cæsar{G2541}, have I offended{G264} any thing at all{G5100}.

But{G1161} Festus{G3588}, willing{G2309} to do{G2698} the Jews{G2453} a pleasure{G5485}, answered{G611} Paul{G3588}, and said{G2036}, Wilt thou{G2309} go up{G305} to{G1519} Jerusalem{G2414}, and there{G1563} be judged{G2919} of{G4012} these things{G5130} before{G1909} me{G1700}?

Then{G1161} said{G2036} Paul{G3588}, I{G1510} stand{G2476} at{G1909} Cæsar's{G2541} judgment seat{G3588}, where{G3757} I{G3165} ought{G1163} to be judged{G2919}: to the Jews{G2453} have I done{G91} no{G3762} wrong{G91}, as{G5613} thou{G4771} very well{G2566} knowest{G1921}.

For{G1063} if{G1487} I be an offender{G91}, or{G2532} have committed{G4238} any thing{G5100} worthy{G514} of death{G2288}, I refuse{G3868} not{G3756} to die{G599}: but{G1161} if{G1487} there be{G2076} none{G3762} of these things whereof{G3739} these{G3778} accuse{G2723} me{G3450}, no man{G3762} may{G1410} deliver{G5483} me{G3165} unto them{G846}. I appeal unto{G1941} Cæsar{G2541}.
Then{G5119} Festus{G3588}, when he had conferred{G4814}with{G3326} the council{G3588}, answered{G611}, Hast thou appealed{G1941} unto Cæsar{G2541}? unto{G1909} Cæsar{G2541} shalt thou go{G4198}.
And{G1161} after{G1230} certain{G5100} days{G2250} king{G3588} Agrippa{G67} and{G2532} Bernice{G959} came{G2658} unto{G1519} Cæsarea{G2542} to salute{G782} Festus{G3588}.

And{G1161} when{G5613} they had been{G1304} there{G1563} many{G4119} days{G2250}, Festus{G3588} declared{G394} Paul's{G3588} cause{G2596} unto the king{G3588}, saying{G3004}, There is{G2076} a certain{G5100} man{G435} left{G2641} in bonds{G1198} by{G5259} Felix{G5344}:

About{G4012} whom{G3739}, when I{G3450} was{G1096} at{G1519} Jerusalem{G2414}, the chief priests{G3588} and{G2532} the elders{G4245} of the Jews{G2453} informed{G1718} me, desiring{G154} to have judgment{G1349} against{G2596} him{G846}.

To{G4314} whom{G3739} I answered{G611}, It is{G2076} not{G3756} the manner{G1485} of the Romans{G4514} to deliver{G5483} any{G5100} man{G444} to{G1519} die{G684}, before{G4250} that{G2228} he which{G3588} is accused{G2723} have{G2192} the accusers{G3588} face{G4383} to{G2596} face{G4383}, and{G5037} have{G2983} licence{G5117} to answer for himself{G627} concerning{G4012} the crime laid against him{G3588}.

Therefore{G3767}, when they{G846} were come{G4905} hither{G1759}, without{G3367} any delay{G311} on the morrow{G1836} I sat{G2523} on{G1909} the judgment seat{G3588}, and commanded{G2753} the man{G3588} to be brought forth{G71}.
Against{G4012} whom{G3739} when the accusers{G3588} stood up{G2476}, they brought{G2018} none{G3762} accusation{G156} of such things{G3739} as I{G1473} supposed{G5282}:

But{G1161} had{G2192} certain{G5100} questions{G2213} against{G4314} him{G846} of{G4012} their own{G2398} superstition{G1175}, and{G2532} of{G4012} one{G5100} Jesus{G2424}, which was dead{G2348}, whom{G3739} Paul{G3588} affirmed{G5335} to be alive{G2198}.

And{G1161} because{G639} I{G1473} doubted{G639} of{G1519} such{G4012} manner{G5127} of questions{G2214}, I asked{G3004} him whether{G1487} he would{G1014} go{G4198} to{G1519} Jerusalem{G2419}, and there{G2546} be judged{G2919} of{G4012} these matters{G5130}.

But{G1161} when Paul{G3972} had appealed{G1941} to be reserved{G5083} unto{G1519} the hearing{G1233} of Augustus{G4575}, I commanded{G2753} him{G846} to be kept{G5083} till{G2193} I might send{G3992} him{G846} to{G4314} Cæsar{G2541}.
Then{G1161} Agrippa{G67} said{G5346} unto{G4314} Festus{G3588}, I would{G1014} also{G2532} hear{G191} the man{G3588} myself{G846}. To morrow{G839}, said he{G5346}, thou shalt hear{G191} him{G846}.

And{G3767} on the morrow{G1887}, when Agrippa{G3588} was come{G2064}, and{G2532} Bernice{G3588}, with{G3326} great{G4183} pomp{G5325}, and{G2532} was entered{G1525} into{G1519} the place of hearing{G3588}, with{G4862} the chief captains{G3588}, and{G2532} principal{G1851} men{G435} of the city{G3588}, at{G2596}Festus'{G3588} commandment{G2753} Paul{G3588} was brought forth{G71}.

And{G2532} Festus{G3588} said{G5346}, King{G935} Agrippa{G67}, and{G2532} all men{G3956} which{G3588} are here present{G4840} with us{G2254}, ye see{G2334} this{G5126} man{G435}, about{G4012} whom{G3739} all{G3956} the multitude{G3588} of the Jews{G2453} have dealt{G1793} with me{G3427}, both{G5037} at{G1722} Jerusalem{G2414}, and{G2532} also here{G1759}, crying that{G1916} he{G846} ought{G1163} not{G3361} to live{G2198} any longer{G3371}.Extra word here "theoreo"

But{G1161} when I{G1473} found{G2638} that he{G846} had committed{G4238} nothing{G3367} worthy{G514} of death{G2288}, and{G2532} that he{G5127} himself{G846} hath appealed to{G1941} Augustus{G4575}, I have determined{G2919} to send{G3992} him{G846}.

Of{G4012} whom{G3739} I have{G2192} no{G3756} certain{G804} thing{G5100} to write{G1125} unto my lord{G3588}. Wherefore{G1352} I have brought{G4254} him{G846} forth{G4254} before{G1909} you{G5216}, and{G2532} specially{G3122} before{G1909} thee{G4675}, O king{G935} Agrippa{G67}, that{G3704}, after examination{G3588} had{G1096}, I might have{G2192} somewhat{G5100} to write{G1125}.
For{G1063} it seemeth{G1380} to me{G3427} unreasonable{G249} to send{G3992} a prisoner{G1198}, and{G2532} not{G3361} withal to signify{G4591} the crimes{G156} laid against{G2596} him{G846}.
